paper_title.ja: Interdisciplinary approach including orthodontic treatment with skeletal anchorage and autotrans plantation for an adult patient with periodontitis

paper_title.en: Interdisciplinary approach including orthodontic treatment with skeletal anchorage and autotrans plantation for an adult patient with periodontitis
A case of congenital unilateral maxillo-mandibular bony fusion in an 8-year-old girl

description.en: Congenital fusion of the mandible to maxilla can involve soft tissue (synechiae) or bone (syngnathia). Congenital synechiae has been widely reported, whereas congenital syngnathia is rare. Syngnathia severely limits mouth opening. To improve airway control and prevent feeding handicaps, surgical division of the bony fusion or breakdown of the adhesions is recommended within the first few days of life. We described an 8-year-old girl who had unilateral syngnathia with micromandible, reactive coronoid process hyperplasia, cleft palate and congenital corneal opacity. She first underwent surgical treatment to improve jaw function at the age of 8 years. Delayed surgery slightly improved restricted mouth opening. © 2010 Asian Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.

publication_name.en: Asian Journal of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery

paper_title.en: A case of congenital unilateral maxillo-mandibular bony fusion in an 8-year-old girl

description.en: Congenital fusion of the mandible to maxilla can involve soft tissue (synechiae) or bone (syngnathia). Congenital synechiae has been widely reported, whereas congenital syngnathia is rare. Syngnathia severely limits mouth opening. To improve airway control and prevent feeding handicaps, surgical division of the bony fusion or breakdown of the adhesions is recommended within the first few days of life. We described an 8-year-old girl who had unilateral syngnathia with micromandible, reactive coronoid process hyperplasia, cleft palate and congenital corneal opacity. She first underwent surgical treatment to improve jaw function at the age of 8 years. Delayed surgery slightly improved restricted mouth opening. © 2010 Asian Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.

paper_title.ja: 脂肪腫を伴う正中上顎歯槽突起裂と先天性外鼻孔腫瘤を示しPai症候群が疑われた患児の1例

description.ja: 症例は生後11日の男児で、出生時、正中上顎歯槽突起部に腫瘤を認め、その精査を目的に来院した。左側外鼻孔鼻柱基部皮膚には5×5×3mmの腫瘤を認めた。また、正中上顎歯槽突起部には裂がみられ、その裂底部に基部を有する15×5×5mmの腫瘤を認めた。口腔内腫瘤を可及的に切除した。病理組織検査は脂肪腫であった。生後6ヵ月時には、口腔内より裂底部の残存腫瘍摘出術、上唇小帯修正術を行った。2歳4ヵ月時には、外鼻孔腫瘤を皮膚側から切除した。病理組織検査は脂肪腫であった。その後、口腔内外共に腫瘍の再発はみられない。Pai症候群の疑いで5歳7ヵ月時に全身検査を行った。染色体検査は46、XYの男性核型であった。脳MRI検査で頭蓋内脂肪腫はみられなかったが、右側頭部に多少脳回を認めた。顔貌・口腔内所見から、脂肪腫を伴う正中上顎歯槽突起、先天性外鼻孔腫瘤を有するPai症候群の亜型と診断した。

paper_title.ja: 過去10年間の口腔扁平上皮癌一次症例における臨床的検討
paper_title.en: 過去10年間の口腔扁平上皮癌一次症例における臨床的検討

description.ja: 1989年から1998年までの10年間に東北大学病院顎顔面外科を受診し、病理組織学的に扁平上皮癌と診断された一次症例133例について臨床統計的検討を行ったので、その概要について報告する。対象症例の男女比は1.7:1で平均年齢は62.1歳であった。最も多い発生部位は舌で48.1%であった。WHOの病理組織学的分化度の分類によるとGrade 1(高分化型)が最多で、75症例(56.4%)であった。UICCのTNM分類(2003年)に従って分類すると、T分類ではT1:21.8%,T2:36.8%,T3:16.6%,T4:24.8%であり、臨床的に頸部リンパ節が陽性と判断した症例は47.8%、遠隔転移を認めた症例はわずかに1例で肺転移であった。Stage分類では、Stage I:19.5%,Stage II:24.1%,Stage III:24.8%,Stage IV:31.6%でStageが上がるごとに症例数も増加しておりStage IVが最多であった。治療法の内訳としては110症例(82.7%)が手術療法を受けており、化学療法・放射線療法・手術療法の3者併用療法は44症例(33.1%)で施行されていた。Kaplan-Meier法による5年累積生存率は全症例で66.4%であり、手術療法が施行された症例では72.9%であった。(著者抄録)

paper_title.ja: 下顎骨関節突起骨折における吸収性プレート使用例の予後について

paper_title.en: 下顎骨関節突起骨折における吸収性プレート使用例の予後について
Natural course of disc displacement with reduction of the temporomandibular joint: Changes in clinical signs and symptoms

description.en:
Purpose: The goal of this study was to examine the natural course of disc displacement with reduction in the temporomandibular joint (TMJ).
Patients and Methods: This retrospective study involved 24 patients who had been diagnosed with disc displacement with reduction of the TMJ, but who had not undergone any treatment. The extent of maximal mouth opening, protrusion, lateral excursions, noise of the TMJ, pain of the TMJ, and tenderness of masticatory muscles were recorded monthly for a mean of 25.8 months.
Results: Maximal mouth opening, protrusion, and lateral excursions remained unchanged during follow-up. TMJ pain decreased by 15.7% (P > .05). Clicking decreased by 20.8% (P < .05), and tenderness of masticatory muscles decreased by 33.3% (P < .05). Reciprocal clicking remained unchanged in 19 patients (79.2%) and disappeared in 5 patients (23.8%). Four patients (16.7%) in whom clicking disappeared had a normal mouth opening, but locking developed in 1 patient (4.2%).
Conclusions: In patients with disc displacement with reduction who do not undergo treatment, range of movement remains unchanged over time. Tenderness of masticatory muscles tended lessen, but reciprocal clicking and TMJ pain tended to remain. Clicking did not progress to locking in most patients. (C) 2003 American Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF ORAL AND MAXILLOFACIAL SURGERY

paper_title.en: Natural course of disc displacement with reduction of the temporomandibular joint: Changes in clinical signs and symptoms

description.en:
Purpose: The goal of this study was to examine the natural course of disc displacement with reduction in the temporomandibular joint (TMJ).
Patients and Methods: This retrospective study involved 24 patients who had been diagnosed with disc displacement with reduction of the TMJ, but who had not undergone any treatment. The extent of maximal mouth opening, protrusion, lateral excursions, noise of the TMJ, pain of the TMJ, and tenderness of masticatory muscles were recorded monthly for a mean of 25.8 months.
Results: Maximal mouth opening, protrusion, and lateral excursions remained unchanged during follow-up. TMJ pain decreased by 15.7% (P > .05). Clicking decreased by 20.8% (P < .05), and tenderness of masticatory muscles decreased by 33.3% (P < .05). Reciprocal clicking remained unchanged in 19 patients (79.2%) and disappeared in 5 patients (23.8%). Four patients (16.7%) in whom clicking disappeared had a normal mouth opening, but locking developed in 1 patient (4.2%).
Conclusions: In patients with disc displacement with reduction who do not undergo treatment, range of movement remains unchanged over time. Tenderness of masticatory muscles tended lessen, but reciprocal clicking and TMJ pain tended to remain. Clicking did not progress to locking in most patients. (C) 2003 American Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgeons.
